sp.speaker: SCENE : A Hall of Judgment in the palace of SAUL at Gibeah
sp.p: The walls and pillars of cedar are richly carven — with serpents , pomegranates , and cherubim in gold . The floors are of bright marble ; the throne of ivory hung with a lion 's skin whose head is its footstool . On the right , by the throne , and on the left are doors to other portions of the palace ; they are draped with woven curtains of purple and white . In the rear , which is open and supported on pillars , a porch crosses a court . Through the porch , on the environing hills , glow the camp-fires of the Philistines , the enemies of Israel . Lamps in the Hall burn low , and on the floor JUDITH , LEAH and ZILLA are reclining restively . Judithspringing to her feet impatientlyO for a feast , pomegranate wine and song !

sp.speaker: Zilla
sp.p: A feast indeed ! the men in camp ! When was a laugh or any leaping here ? Never ; and none to charm with timbreling !

lg.l: Or till a youth wed Zilla for her beauty ?
I 'll not soil mine with sullen fear all day
Because these Philistines press round . As well
Be wenches gathering grapes or wool ! Come , Leah .
No , Judith , I 'll put henna on my nails ,
And mend my anklet .
Zilla
Oh ! Oh ! Oh !

sp.speaker: Judith
sp.p: Now , hear her ! Who , who , now ? who , who is it ? dog , fox , devil ?

sp.speaker: Judith
sp.p: Then ‘ tis Ishui !Bounding to curtains .Yes , Ishui ! And fury in him , sallow , souring fury ! A jackal were his mate ! Come , come , we 'll plague him .

sp.speaker: Zilla
sp.p: Shall we — with David whom he hates ?

sp.speaker: Judith
sp.p: Aie , David ! The joy of rousing men to jealousy !

sp.speaker: Judith
sp.p: Hush , hush , be meet and ready now ; he 's near . Look as for silly visions and for dreams !

div.stage: They pose . ISHUI entering sees them . JUDITH sighs .

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: Now , timbrel-gaud , why gape you here ?

lg.l: O ! ‘ tis
Prince Ishui !
Prince Ishui ! Then he
Will tell us ! he will tell us !
Of David !
O , is he come ? when , where ?— quick , quick . And will
He pluck us ecstasies out of his harp ,
Winning until we 're wanton for him , mad ,
And sigh and laugh and weep to the moon ?

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: Low thing ! Chaff of the king !

sp.speaker: Judith
sp.p: The king ! I had not thought ! David a king ! how beauteous would he be !

sp.speaker: Judith
sp.p: Turban of sapphire ! robe of gold !

lg.l: Who , who can tell ?
Have you not heard ? Yesterday in the camp ,
Among war-old but fearful men , he offered
Kingly to meet Goliath — great Goliath !

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: What do you say ? to meet Goliath ? Judithlaughing in his faceAie !Thrust from him , she goes , dancing with ZILLA and LEAH .Adrielwho has enteredIshui , in a rage ?

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: Not ?Deftly .You say well . I should not , no . Pardon then , Adriel .

lg.l: Turn from it : I have not
Bidden you here for vapours ... tho ’ they had
Substance as well for you !
Who likes
Laughter against him ?
Why ,
It is this shepherd !
With his harp !
Flinging enchantment on the palace air
Till he impassions to him all who breathe .

sp.speaker: Adriel
sp.p: What sting from that ? He 's lovable and brave .

lg.l: This , then : you 've hither come with gifts and gold ,
Dream-bringing amethyst and weft of Ind ,
To wed my sister , Merab ?

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: And you 've the king 's consent ; but she denies ?

sp.speaker: Adriel
sp.p: As every wind , you know it .

lg.l: Still denies !
And you , lost in the maze of her , fare on
Blindly and find no reason for it !
How ?
What reason can be ? women are not clear ;
And least unto themselves .
Or to their fools .
lg.stage: Goes to curtain , draws out ADAH .
lg.l: Your mistress , Merab , girl , whom does she love ?
Unclench your hands .
Insolent !
Answer ; I am not milky Jonathan ,
Answer ; and for the rest — You hear ?
She loves —
The shepherd David !
I care not !
She is unkind ; I will not spy for her
On Michal , and I 'll tell her secrets all !
And David does not love her — and she raves .

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: Off to your sleep ; be off —

lg.l: Ishui , no .
Ishui
Then see you now how “ lovable ” he is ?
I tell you that he stands athwart us all !
The heart of Merab swung as a censer to him ,
My seat at table with the king usurped !
Mildew and mocking to the harp of Doeg
As it were any slave 's ; the while we all
Are lepered with suspicion .

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: Ah ! and of Jonathan and Michal .

lg.l: Hush .
Michal , delay . Whom lead you ?
Miriam ,
A prophetess .
He 's not at rest ; dreads Samuel 's prophecy
The throne shall pass from him , and darkens more
Against this boundless Philistine Goliath
Who dares at Israel daily on the hills ,
As we were dogs !
No ;
But he is sent for — and will ease him — Ah !
He 's wonderful to heal the king with his harp !
A waft , a sunny leap of melody ,
And swift the hovering mad shadow 's gone —
As magic !
Disdaining Doeg and his plea to dust ,
His waiting and the winning o'er of Edom ,
You are enamoured of this David too ?

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: I think my brother Ishui hath a fever .

lg.l: Now are you kindled — are you quivering ,
Or must this shepherd put upon us more ?

sp.speaker: Adriel
sp.p: But has he not dealt honourably ?

lg.l: Why have senses . He
With Samuel the prophet fast enshrouds
Some secret , and has Samuel not told
The kingdom from my father shall be rent
And fall unto one another ?
As granite .
Yonder !
And Samuel
With prophecy or some refusal tears him !

div.stage: They step aside . SAUL , followed by SAMUEL , strides in and mounts the throne .

lg.l: You threat , and ever thunder threatening !
Pour seething prophecy into my veins ,
Till a simoon of madness in me moves .
Am I not king , the king ? chosen and sealed ?
Who 've been anathema and have been bane
Unto the foes of Israel , and filled
The earth with death of them ?
And do you still forbid that I bear gold
And bribe away this Philistine array
Folded about us , fettering with flame ?
Yes ,— yes ! While there is air — and awe of Heaven
Do I forbid ! A champion must rise
To level this Goliath . Thus may we
Loose on them pest of panic and of fear .
Are forty days not dead ? A champion !
None will arise — ‘ tis vain . And I 'll not wait
On miracle .
Offer thy daughter , then ,
Michal , thy fairest , to whoever shall .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Demand and drain for more ! without an end . Ever vexation ! No ; I will not .

lg.l: Then ,
Out of Jehovah and a vast foreseen
I tell thee again , thou perilous proud king ,
The sceptre shall slip from thee to another !
From me ! No !
You rouse afar the billowing of ill .
I grant — go not !— I grovel to your will ,
Fear it and fawn as to omnipotence ,
And vow to all its divination — all !
Then , Saul of Israel , the hour is near ,
When shall arise one , and Goliath fall !
lg.stage: Goes slowly out by the porch , Saul sinks back .
lg.l: Ishui
Oh ,— subtle !
Subtle !— subtle !
And yet I must not speak ; come , Adriel ,
No use of us is here .

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: Do not ask .... Yet how it creeps , and how !

lg.l: Do you not see it crawl , this serpent scheme ?
Goliath slain — the people mad with praise ,
Then fallen from you — Michal the victor 's wife ....
Or else the champion slain —
Fear on the people — panic — the kingdom 's ruin !

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Now do the folds slip from me .

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: And you see ? Ah , then , if one arise ? If one arise ?

lg.l: Death , death ! If he hath touched this prophet — if
Merely a little moment !—
I have seen
Your David with him .
The folds slip further ;
To this you lead me — hatred against David !
To this with supple envy 's easy glide !
You have but builded lies ,
As ever you are building and for ever .
I 'll hear no more against him — Abner !— no .
David , and with his harp .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Not come ? He is not come ? Forever he delays !

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: There is not . Am I king ?A harp is heard .See you , ‘ tis he !... ‘ Tis David !... And he sings ! Davidbravely , withinSmiter of Hosts , Terrible Saul ! Vile on the hills shall he laugh who boasts None is among Great Israel 's all Fearless for Saul , King Saul !Entering with people of the palace .Aye , is there none Galled of the sting , Will at the soul of Goliath run ? Wring it and up To his false gods fling ?... None for the king , the king ?He drops to his knee , amid praise , before the throne .SauldarkeningForego this praise and stand Away from him ; ‘ tis overmuch .

div.stage: To DAVID . ) Why have You dallied and delayed ?

lg.l: Why , my lord ,
I do not mock . Only the birds have wings .
Yet on the vales behind me I have left
Haste and a swirl , a wonderment of air ,
And in the torrent 's troubled vein amaze ,
So swift I hurried hither at your urgence
Out of the fields and folding the far sheep !

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: You have not ; you have dallied .Motions rest out .You have dallied .Comes down indeterminately .And now ——

lg.l: And now the king with darkness foams ,
With sheeted passions like to lightning gusts .
Shall I not play to him ?
You shall not , no .
I 'll not be lulled .
But show a tiger gleam ?
Terrible fury stealing from the heart
And crouching cold within the eye , O Saul ?

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: I 'll not endure . They say that you ——

lg.l: They say ?
What is this ravage in you ? Does the truth
So limpid overflow in palaces ?
Never an enemy to venom it ?
Am I not David , faithful , and thy friend ?

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: I 'll slay you and regretless . DavidunmovingSlay , my lord ?

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Do you not fear ? And brave me to my breast ?

lg.l: Have I done wrong that I should fear the king ?
Reed as I am , could he not breathe and break ?
And I should be oblivion at a word !
But under the terror of his might have I
Not seen his heart beat justice and beat love ?
See , even now !...

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: I will not listen to them !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: To whom , my lord , and what ?

lg.l: Ever they say ,
“ This David , ” and “ This David ! ”

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: But think you , David , I shall lose the kingdom ? DavidstartingMy lord !...

lg.l: Pain in your eyes ? you think it ? Deem
I cannot overleap this destiny ?
To that let us not verge ; it has but ill .
Deeper the future gulf is for our fears .
Forget it . Forget the brink may ever gape ,
And wield the throne so well that God Himself
Must not unking you , more than He would cry
The morning star from Heaven ! Then , I swear it ,
None else will !
But words ,
Foolishly from the heart ; a shepherd speech !
Give them no mood ; but see , see yonder fires
Camping upon the peace of Israel ,
As we were carrion beneath the sun !
Let us conceive annihilation on them ,
Hurricane rush and deluging and ruin .
Ah , but the prophecy ! the prophecy !
It eats in me the food of rest and ease .
And David , nearer : Samuel in my stead
Another hath anointed .
Saul , not this !
This should not fall to me , my lord ; no more !
You cannot understand ; it pains beyond
All duty and enduring !

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Pains beyond ...? Who is he ? know you of him ? do you ? know you ? You sup the confidence of Samuel ? I 'll search from Nile to Nineveh ——

lg.l: Mountain and desert , wilderness and sea ,
Under and over , search — and find .
O father , father ! David ! Listen !... Why
All here is dark and quivering as pain ,
And a foreboding binds me ere I breathe !
David , you have not been as sun to him !
Father , a secret ! Oh , and it will make
Dawn and delight in you !
Have heard !— Why do you pale ?
Now are you Baal-bit ?
Michal !
Michal
David !... the dread
What does it mean ? I cannot speak ! It shrinks
Shivering down upon my heart in awe !
And numbs you so ?— Let it rush from your lips !
Can any moving in the world so bring
Terror upon you ! Speak , what is it ?
Ah !
I know not ; danger rising and its wing
Sudden against my lips !

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: It shall not ! There — now again flows joy : I think it flows .

lg.l: Yes , father , yes ! Have you
Not much desired discovery of whom
Samuel hath anointed ?
I 've found ——
Almost have found ! A prophetess to-day
Hath told me that he is a ——
Now you cease ?
Sudden and senseless !
God ! God !
Have I not bidden swiftly ! Ever then
Vexation ? I could — Ah . Will she not speak !

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Cannot ! Are you flesh of me ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: My lord , not anger ! Hear me ...

lg.l: Hear !
Her lips could never seal upon a wrong .
Sudden divinity is on them , silence
Sent for the benison of Israel ,
Else were it shattered by her love to you !
Believe , in all the riven realm of duty
There 's no obedience from thee she would hold .
If it seem other ——

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: I will not . Do you come with vexing too ?

lg.l: The Philistines — some fury is afoot ;
A spy 's within our gates — and scorns to speak .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Conspiracy of silence !... Back to him .ABNER goes .To DAVID and MICHAL .But you — I 'll not forget . I 'll not forget .Goes trembling , his look bent backward still upon them .Davidcasting off gloom , then joyfulForget ! anointing peril ! What are they all ? Michal !— for me you have done this , for me ?She stands immovable .I 'm swung with joy as palms of Abila !Goes to her .A princess , you ! and warm within your veins Live sympathy and all love unto your father , Yet you have shielded me ?

lg.l: I am — oh , do not flint your loveliness !—
I am the anointed , but all innocent
In will or hope of any envious wrong ,
As lily blowing of blasphemy ! as dew
Upon it is of enmity !

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: Anointed ! You whom the king uplifted from the fields !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: And who am ever faithful to him !

lg.l: You ,
Whom Jonathan loves more than women love !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Yet reaches not my love to Jonathan !

lg.l: O hear !
Of my anointing Jonathan is ‘ ware ,
Knows it is holy , helpless , innocent
As dawn or a drift of dreaming in the night !
Knows it unsought — out of the skies — supernal —
From the inspired cruse of Samuel !
For Israel it dripped upon me , and
For Israel must drip until I die !
Or till high Gath and Askalon are blown
Dust on the wind , and all Philistia
Lie peopleless and still under the stars !...
Goliath , then , a laughter evermore !...
Still , still you shrink ? do you not see , not feel ?
So have you breathed yourself about my heart ,
Even as moonlit incense , spirit flame
Burning away all barrier !
And all the world has streamed a rapture in ,
Till even now my lids from anger falter
And the dew falls !
Restrain ! O do not weep !
Upon my heart each tear were as a sea
Flooding it from all duty but the course
Of thy delight !
Poor , that I should have tears !
Fury were better , tempest ! O weak eyes ,
When ‘ tis my father , and with Samuel
You creep to steal his kingdom !
Cruel ! fell accusal ! Yea ,
Utterly false and full of wounding !
Yet ,
Forgive that even when thy arrows sink
Deeper than all the skill of time can draw ,
I spare thee not the furrowed face of pain ...
Delirious wings of hope that fluttered up ,
At last to fall !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Peace to you , peace and joy !

div.stage: He turns . She sways and reaches to him her arms . As they move together DOEG and MERAB appear , but vanish from the curtains as MICHAL utters dismay .

lg.l: Merab and Doeg !
David
Yet what matter , now !
Were it the driven night-unshrouded dead !
Under the firmament is but one need ,
That you will understand !
But Merab ! ah ,
She 's cunning , cold and cruel , and she loves thee ;
Hath told her love to Ahinoam the queen !
And Doeg hates thee — since for me he 's mad !
Then be his hate as wild , as wide as winds
That gather up the desert for their blast ,
Be it as Sheol deep , stronger than stars
That fling fate on us , and I care not , care not ,
If I am trusted and to Michal truth !
Hear , hear me ! for the kingdom , tho ‘ t may come ,
I yearn not ; but for you !
For you !
Since I a shepherd o'er a wild of hills
First beheld you the daughter of the king
Amid his servants , leaning , still with noon ,
Beautiful under a tamarisk , until
All beauty else is dead ——
Since then
I have been wonder , ecstasy and dream !
The moulded light and fragrant miracle ,
Body of you and soul , lifted me till
When you departed ——
No , you rend me !
David . I
Fell thro ’ infinity of void !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Then came the prophet Samuel with anointing ! My hope sprung as the sun !

lg.l: Then was I called to play before the king .
Here in this hall where cherubim shine out ,
Where the night silence ——
Strung me tense ,
I waited , shepherd-timid , and you came ,
You for the king to try my skill ! you , you !

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: Leave me , ah leave ! I yield !

lg.l: And often since
Have we not swayed and swept thro ’ happy hours ,
Far from the birth unto the bourne of bliss ?
To-night you did not to the king
Reveal my helpless chrism , give me to peril .
Say but the reason !
And shall I , shall I ? how this prophetess
Miriam hath foretold ——

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Some wonder ? speak ! Michalsprings up the throne , then downNo , no ! horror in me moans out against it . Wed me with destiny against my father ? Dethrone my mother ? Ah !

lg.l: Then swear conspiracy upon its tide
Never shall lift you !
Deeper than soul or sea ,
Deep as divinity is deep , I swear .
If it shall come , the kingdom ——
“ If ! ” not “ if . ”
Surrender this anointing ! Spurn it , say
You never will be king though Israel
Kingless go mad for it !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: I cannot — and I must not . It is holy !

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: Then must I hate you — scorn you ——

lg.l: And will .
But to reign over Israel you care ,
Not for the peace of it !
Thus all is vain ;
A seething on the lips , I 'll say no more ....
Care but to reign and not for Israel 's calm ?
I who am wounded with her every wound ?...
Look out upon yon Philistine bold fires
Lapping the night with bloody tongue — look out !
As God has swung the world and hung for ever
The infinite in awe , to-morrow night
Not one of them shall burn !
What is this strength ! It seizes on me ! No ,
I 'll not believe ; no , no , more than I would
From a boy 's breath or the mere sling you wear
A multitude should flee ! And you shall learn
A daughter to a father may be true
Tho ’ paleness be her doom until she die !

div.stage: She turns to go . Enter JONATHAN eagerly .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: My friend — my Jonathan ! ‘ Tis you ?

lg.l: Great heart , I 've heard how yesterday before
The soldiers you .... But Michal 's gone ! No word ?
And disdains
Believing ? tell me .
No , not now — not now .
Let me forget it in a leap of deeds .
For there is murmur misty of distress ,
What is it ? sprung of the Philistines ? new terror ?
This sounding giant flings again his foam ?
Jonathan , I am flame that will not wait .
What is it ? I must strike .
Tell me ,
And do not bring dissuasion more , or pause .
With a spy who keeps
Fiercely to silence .
David , you must cool from this .
Determination surges you o'erfar .
I will not see you rush on perishing ,
Not though it be the aid of Israel .
I must .... I will not let them ever throng ,
Staining the hills , and starving us from peace .
Rather the last ray living in me , rather
Death and the desecration of the worm .
Bid me not back with love , nor plea ; I must !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: They come .Enter SAUL , with SAMUEL ; soldiers with the spy , AHINOAM with ABNER ; and all the court in suppressed dread .Saulto SAMUELHe will not speak , but scorns me , and his lips Bitterly curve and grapple . But he shall Learn there is torture to it ! Set him forth .The spy is thrust forward .Tighten his bonds up till he moan .It is done .Aye , gasp , Accursed Philistine ! Now wilt thou tell The plan and passion of the people ‘ gainst us ?

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Tighten the torture more .... Now will you ? Spyin agonyYea !

lg.l: New forces have arrived ,
Numberless ; more than peaks of Arabah .
Unless before to-morrow 's moon one 's sent
To overthrow Goliath ... Gods ! the pain !
Then Gibeah attacked , and all ,
Even to sucking babes , they 'll put to sword !
Then , Saul of Gibeah , one thing and one
Alone is to be done . A champion ,
To break this beetling giant down to death !

sp.speaker: Samuel
sp.p: Is none ! Call ! I order it .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Then who will dare against him !A silence .See you now .

sp.speaker: Samuel
sp.p: Doeg , chief servant of the king ?

sp.speaker: Doeg
sp.p: Why me ? Had I a mother out of Israel ? I am an alien , an Edomite .

lg.l: My lord , this is no more endurable !
Futile and death ? Alien ? Edomite ?
Has not this Philistine before the gates ,
With insult and illimitable breath
Vaunting of vanity and smiting laughter ,
Boasted and braved and threatened up to Baal ?
And now unless one slay him , Israel
From babe to age must bleed and be no more !
I am a shepherd , have but seized the lion
And throttled the bleating kid out of his throat ;
Little it then beseems that I thrust in
Where battle captains pale and falter off ;
But this is past all carp of rank or station .
One must go out — Goliath must have end .
Sudden you hound about me ravenous ?
Have I thrown doom not daring to your feet ,
Ruler of Israel , that you rise wild ,
Livid above me as an avalanche ?
A plot ! it is a plot ! He will be slain —
From you , my lord , dominion then will fall !
Or should it not ...
Liar ! it is no plot .
But courage sprung seraphic out of night ,
Beautiful , yea , a bravery from God !
Michal
Open ! and let me enter ! Open !
Father !
It is not false ? but now , the uttermost ?
To-morrow , if Goliath still exult ,
There 's peril of desolation , bloody ruin ?
Then to your will ,
Father , unto will of yesterday
I bend me now with sacrificial joy .
Unto Goliath 's slayer is the hand
Of Michal , the king 's daughter !
David
Michal ! Michal !

sp.speaker: Doeg
sp.p: See you , my lord ? Do you not understand ?

sp.speaker: Ishui
sp.p: It is another coiling of their plot !

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: Coiling of plot ? What mean you ?

lg.l: Ah ! You know
Not it is David offers against Goliath ?

div.stage: A low tumult is heard without . Enter a Captain hurriedly .

sp.speaker: Captain
sp.p: O King , bid me to speak !

lg.l: Fear is upon the host . There will
Be mutiny unless , Goliath slain ,
Courage spring up anew .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: My lord , then , choose ! Ere longer waiting fester to disaster .

lg.l: Yea , king of Gibeah , and bid him go ,
And Michal for his meed ! or evermore
Evil be on you and the sear of shame —
And haunting memory beyond the tomb !
Then let him — let him . And upon the field
Of Ephes-Dammin . But I am not blind !
Let him , to-morrow ! Go prepare the host .
Yet — I am king , remember ! I am king !

div.stage: SAUL goes ; murmurs of relief ... All follow , but MICHAL , past DAVID with joy or hate .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Michal !She struggles against tears , but , turning , goes . He stands and gazes after her . Then a trumpet sounds and soldiers throng to the porch .Davidthrilled , his hand on his slingFor Israel ! For Israel !

div.head: ACT II

stage.stage: SCENE .— The royal tent of SAUL pitched on one hill of the battlefield of Ephes-Dammin . The tent is of black embroidered with various warlike designs . To one side on a dais are the chairs of SAUL and AHINOAM ; also DAVID 'S harp . On the other side , toward the front , is a table with weapons . The tent wall is lifted along the back , revealing on the opposite hill , across a deep narrow valley , the routed camp of the Philistines ; before it in gleaming brazen armour lies GOLIATH slain . Other hills beyond , and the sky above . By the small table , her back to the battlefield , sits MERAB in cold anger . AHINOAM and several women look out in ecstasy toward DAVID , SAUL , JONATHAN , and the army , returning victorious , and shouting .

sp.speaker: Third Woman
sp.p: An avalanche ! Over the brook and bright amid hosannas !

sp.speaker: First Woman
sp.p: And the servants ! Goliath 's head high-borne upon a charger ! The rocks that cry reverberant and vast ! The people and the palms !

lg.l: Yea , all the branches
Torn from the trees ! The waving of them — O !
And David , see ! triumphant , calm , between
The king and Jonathan !... His glory
All the wild generations of the wind
Ever shall utter ! Hear them —
“ David ! David ! ”
O queen ! a sea of shouting !

sp.speaker: Ahinoam
sp.p: Which you crave ? Then go and lave you in this tide of joy .

div.stage: The women go rapturously . AHINOAM turns .

sp.speaker: Ahinoam
sp.p: I do not know , my child .

lg.l: Why did my father pledge her to him ? you
Not hindering ?
She is your sister . You
Are pledged to Adriel .

sp.speaker: Merab
sp.p: And as a slave ! And if I do not love him there is — riches ! If he is Sodom-bitter to me — riches !

lg.l: For my torture ! What
Kingdom is to a woman as her love ?
Though he never
Sought me with any murmur or desire !
Though he is Michal 's for Goliath 's death !
Michal 's to-day , unless ——

sp.speaker: Ahinoam
sp.p: Merab , a care ! Too near in you were ever love and hate .The tumult nears . AHINOAM goes to look out . DOEG enters to MERAB .DoeglowNews , Merab !

lg.l: A triumph o'er him , yet !
The king is worn , as a leper pent , between
Wonder of David and quick jealousy
Because of praise this whelming of Goliath
Wakes in the people .
This .
I 've skilfully disposed the women
To coldly sing of Saul , but of our David
With lavish of ecstasy as to a king .
Merab
Then I will praise him !
As he
Was never — and shall never be again .

sp.speaker: Doeg
sp.p: What will you do ? Merabseizes phialAt once with it .

sp.speaker: Merab
sp.p: As any fool ? Wait . And the rest now , quick . This timbrel-player , Judith ?

lg.l: She is ready
And ravishing !
We will send her
Sudden , as Michal is alone with David ,
To seize him with insinuative kisses ,
And arms that wind as they were wonted to him .
Michal once jealous — and already I
Have sowed suspicions ——

sp.speaker: Merab
sp.p: May it be their rending .The tumult near .But come , come , we must see ; and show no frown .They go to look out . Shouts of “ David ! David ! ” arise , and timbrelers , dancing and singing , pass the tent opening ; then priests with the Ark and its cherubim of gold . DAVID , SAUL , JONATHAN , ISHUI , and the court then enter amid acclamations . Before them the head of Goliath is borne on a charger , under a napkin . SAUL darkly mounts the throne with AHINOAM , to waving of palms and praise .A Womanbreaking from the throngOur little ones are saved ! Hosannah ! joy !

lg.l: Woman , thy tongue should know an angel-word ,
Or seraph syllables new-sung to God !
Earth has not any rapture well for this !
David , my brother !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Jonathan , my friend ! While life has any love , know mine for you .

lg.l: Then am I friended as no man was ever !
And though my soul were morning wide it were
Helpless to hold my wonder and delight !
O people , look upon him !
Never before in Israel rose beauty
Up to this glory !
Never !
Therefore I pour him splendour passionate .
In gold and purple , this my own , I clothe him .
David , my brother !
Saul
Brother !

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Thou full-of-lauding fool ! Of breath and ravishment unceasing !

lg.l: Is it not praise enough , has he not reached
The skies on it ?
Had Saul
Ever so rich a rapture from his son ?
Ever this worshipping of utterance ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: My lord , my lord , this should not fret you . DoegderisivelyNay !

lg.l: ‘ Tis only that the soul of Jonathan ,
Brimmed by the Philistines with bitterness ,
Sudden is joy and overfloweth ——

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Upon his friend , thy servant , David .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Why ! A WomanwithoutKing Saul has slain his thousands !

sp.speaker: Doeg
sp.p: Do you hear ? King Saul has slain his thousands , David ten ! Thy servant , is he ? servant ?

lg.l: Yea , O king !...
Therefore be wielded by no venom-word ,
As a weed under the wind !
‘ Tis overmuch !
I 'll burst all bond of priest or prophesy .
Nor cringe to threatening and fondle fear .
I 'll smite where'er I will .
No !
For rapid palsy would come on thy hand ,
Awful and sceptre-ruined lord of men ,
An impotence , a shrivelling with fear ,
Avenging ere thou shed offenceless blood !
Is this thy love , the love of Saul the king ,
Who once was kindlier than kindest are ?
For but a woman 's wantonness of word
And idle air , my life ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Some enemy — does Doeg curve his lip ?— Hath put into her mouth this stratagem Of fevered , false-impassioned overpraise .SAUL , tortured , sweeps from the tent , entreated of JONATHAN . Many follow in doubt , whispering .Doegat door , to DavidThis is not all , boy out of Bethlehem . Goliath 's dead ——

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: But not all villainy ?Only MICHAL and MERAB are left with DAVID ; he waits .Merabafter a pause , then as if in shameI burn for it !

sp.speaker: Merab
sp.p: My father so ungenerously wroth ! And wrought away from recompense so right . Can you forgive him ?

lg.l: Is it strange
That even I now ask it ?

sp.speaker: Merab
sp.p: Herself and not to-day your friend ; but now Conquered to exultation and aglow To wreathe you for this might to Israel , Beautiful , unbelievable and bright ! Noble the dawn of it was in your dream , Noble the lightning of it in your arm , And noble in your veins the fearless flow And dare of blood !— so noble that I ask As a remembrance and bequest for ever , In priceless covenant of peace between us , A drop of it ——She draws dagger and offers it to him .Upon this sacred blade ...

lg.l: Poor requital
To one whose greatness humbles me from hate .
David
Then of my veins whatever drop you will
But , no ...
You do not mock me ?
Rather upon
Its edge one vein of you — than priceless nard .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Or perfume out of India jewel poured ?He searches her eyes .Or than — I may believe ?— a miracle Of dew , were you a traveller upon The illimitable desert 's thirst ? Or than —He draws his own dagger , pricks his wrist , and hands it her .Than this ?

sp.speaker: Merab
sp.p: Shepherd ! DavidquicklyTreachery ? treachery , then ? Under a sham of tribute poison ?

lg.l: And I of vanity should prick it in ?
I a mere shepherd innocent of wile !
A singer music-maudled and no more ?...
The daughter of King Saul has yet to learn .
lg.stage: She goes . He turns to MICHAL .
lg.l: But you , fairest of all my hopes , what word !
The vaunting of this victory is done .
We are alone at last .
That is all ?...
For Israel I 've wrought to-day — and for
You , ever round about me as a mist
Of armed mighty angels triumphing .
To you no more ? to you
Whom not a slave can serve unhonoured ?
Michal
Nothing .
Empty of glow then seems it , impotent ,
A shrivelled hallowing ...
Ashes of ecstasy that burned in vain .
No , divine it was !
And had I cried my praise the ground had broke
To Eden under me with blossoming .
Where was so wonderful a deed as this ,
So fair a springing of salvation up ?
Glory above the heavens could I seize ,
Wreathing of dawn and loveliness unfading ,
To crown you with and crown !
With but
A sling , a shepherd 's sling , you sped the brook ,
Drew from its bed a stone , and up the hill
Where the great Philistine contemning cried ,
Mounted and flung it deep upon his brain !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: This is the victory and not his death ! Tell , tell thy joy with kisses on my lips ! Thy mouth ! thy arms ! thy breast !

lg.l: Thy soul !
Too much of waiting and of severance ,
Of dread and distance and the deep of doubt !
Now must I fold you , falter all my love
And triumph on your senses till they burn
Beautiful to eternity with bliss .
A frenzy , ‘ tis a frenzy ! From me ! see !
This irremediable victory
Over Goliath severs us the more .
Hear how the people lift you limitless !
Almost to-day and in my father 's room
They would that you were king .
But ere to-morrow
Dim shall I be , and ere the harvest bend
Less than a gleam in their forgotten peril !
O were it , were it ! But all silently
Jehovah fast is beckoning the realm
Into thy hands .
Then futile to resist
The gliding on of firm divinity .
And yet whatever may be shall be done .
Yet grant
It may be told my father ; that I may
Say to him all the secret !
And provoke
Murder in him , insatiable though
I fled upon the wilderness and famine ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: In vain . MichalcoldlyThen ... it is as I thought .

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: This stroke to-daypointing to GOLIATH 'S headno love of me had in it .

lg.l: A love , a passion fervid through me as
The tread and tremble of seraphic song
Along the infinite .

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: A step to rise and riot in ambition !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: So bitter are you , blind ? even in all ?

lg.l: Cunningly
With Samuel netted fears about my father ,
Till I am paltrily unto you pledged .
No more : the pledge I fling
Out of my heart , as ‘ twere enchantment dead ,
And free you ; but no more .
As if it were
Enchantment dead .... Ah then ‘ tis true — there is
Another — is another !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Now , what fever ? A gentleness clad once your every grace .

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: There is some other that you lure and love .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: It is not Michal speaking ; so I wait .

lg.l: Then you will learn .... Who 's that ?
Why are you here ?
Judith
lg.stage: to DAVID , with a laugh , as if with amorous joy
lg.l: Brave , it was brave , my love ! beauteous ! brave !
The Philistine , a brazen tower ,
A bastion of strength , fell to the earth !
Woman , who are you ?
Take away your flesh .
Take it away , the heat and myrrh of it .

sp.speaker: Judith
sp.p: It is no longer fair ?Wantonly .Oh ! Ah ! I understand ! the princess ! Oh !

div.stage: Goes laughing and shaking her timbrel wickedly .

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: A dancer , then , a very timbrel-player !

lg.l: Until this hour I never looked upon her .
It is chicanery of chance or craft .
You who are noble , though in doubt adrift ,
Be noble now !
And loving ? Oh , I will —
Now that I know what should be done . Be sure !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: You mean ... that Saul ——? You would not , no !

div.stage: A hand is seen at the door . AHINOAM enters .

sp.speaker: Ahinoam
sp.p: David , the king ... But what is this ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: O queen ... It is but life .

lg.l: Life that ever strings
Our hearts , so pitifully prone for it ,
To ecstasy — then snaps .
Then gracious be , and question here no more ,
Where words are futile for an utterance .
But of the king — the king ——?
He 's driven still .
And hither comes again , and must be calmed .
The harp take you , and winds of beauty bring ,
And consolation , as of valley eves
When there is ebb of sorrow and of toil .
Oh , could you heal him and for ever heal !

div.stage: Breaks off with great desire . Takes the harp and seats himself .

sp.speaker: Ahinoam
sp.p: At once , for he will come .

div.stage: A strain of wild sadness brings SAUL , and many , within . He pauses , his hand to his brow , enspelled of the playing ; then slowly goes up the dais .

sp.speaker: Ahinoam
sp.p: My lord , shall David sing — to ease us ?

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Let him . Davidwith high sorrowO heart of woe , Heart of unrest and broken as a reed !Plays .O heart whose flow Is anguish and all bitterness of need !Plays .O heart as a roe , Heart as a hind upon the mountain fleeing The arrow-wounds of being , Be still , O heart , and rest and do not bleed !Plays longer with bowed head .O days of life , Days that are driven swift and wild from the womb !Plays .O days so rife — Days that are torn of trouble , trod of doom !Plays . MICHAL enters .O days of strife — Days of desire on deserts spread unending , The burning blue o'erbending , O days , our peace , our victory is the tomb !He plays to a close that dies in anguished silence .Saulrising in tearsDavid !

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Thy song is beauteous ! Stilling to sorrow !... Oh , my friend , my son !

lg.l: To me is this ? I do not dream ? The king
Again is kind and soft his spirit moves ?
How shelter o'er me then will spring
And safety covering !
It ever shall .
Loveliest have you been among my days ,
And singing weary madness from my brain .
How I have wronged thee !
No ! but he
Is jeopardy and fate about you ! drive
Him from you utterly and now away !
But shall be ; for to tell
Would rend silence for ever from you — pale
Your flesh with haunting of it evermore !
All , all your being would become a hiss ,
A memory of syllables that sear ,
A living iteration of remorse .
I — I myself will save your lips the words
Of this betrayal leaping from your heart .
You seek , my lord ... you seek whom Samuel
Anointed .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Then know that it is I .

lg.l: Guiltless I , no other !
I , though I sought it not and suffer , though —
I would it had not come and fast am sworn
Never against you to lift up ——

sp.speaker: Merab
sp.p: Hear , hear ! Now he will cozen !

lg.l: A thousand Saul hath slain ! but David ten !
Saul
Omnipotence shall not withhold me more .
Die , die !

sp.speaker: Jonathan
sp.p: No , father ... hold ! Michalas SAUL flingsWhat have I done ?

lg.l: David , unhurt ? Away , the wilderness !
Saul
He shall not , no !
David
Strike , strike , then ! strike , strike , strike ,
Murderous king , afoam with murder-heat .
Strike me to darkness and the waiting worm !
But after be your every breathing blood !
Remorse and riving bitterness and fear !
Be guilt and all the hideous choke of horror !

div.stage: SAUL trembling cowers , the javelin falling from him . DAVID breaks through DOEG and ISHUI and escapes by the door . MICHAL sinks to her knees , her face buried in her hands .

div.head: ACT III

stage.stage: SCENE : A savage mountain-cliff in the wilderness of Engeddi . On either side grey crags rise rugged , sinking away precipitously across the back . Cut into each is a cave . The height is reached by clefts from all sides . Between the crags to the East is the far blue of the Dead Sea ; and still beyond , bathed in the waning afternoon , stretch the purple shores of Moab . During the act the scene grows crimson with sunset and a thundercloud arises over the sea . Lying on a pallet of skins near the cliff 's verge , DAVID tosses feverishly . Three of his followers and a lad , who serves him , are gathered toward the front , ragged , hungry , and hunted , in altercation over a barley cake .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Water ! the fever fills me , and I thirst . Water !

sp.speaker: The Lad
sp.p: Yes , yes , my lord .Takes up a water-skin .Ah , empty , not a quaff ! They 've drunk it all from him ! My lord , none 's left . I 'll run and in the valley brim it soon .He goes . DAVID sinks back .Second Folto FIRSTYou drank it , then .

sp.speaker: First Fol
sp.p: And should I thirst , not he ? Give me the bread .

sp.speaker: Second Fol
sp.p: Or betray him ? spitingly ? It is the last . Already you have eat . And we are here within a wilderness .

sp.speaker: First Fol
sp.p: Be it , but I 'll not starve .

lg.l: He utters right .
Why should we but to follow a mere shepherd
Famish — over a hundred desert hills ?
The prophecy portending him the throne —
Folly , not fate ! though it is Samuel 's .
I 'll trust in it no more .
And Saul
Has driven us from waste to waste — pressed us
Even unto the Philistines for shelter ,
And now unto this crag . And is not David 's
Thought but of Michal , not of smiting him
And , with a host , of leaping to the kingdom ?
And fawning too ?
David
Men — men , we must have news . Perpetual ,
Implacable they stare unto each other ,
This rock and stony sky .... We must have news .
lg.stage: Rises and comes down to them . They are silent .
lg.l: Longer is death . ‘ Tis over many days
Of sighing — and remembered verdancy ;
Nor any dew comes here or odour up .
Who will go now and bring us word of Saul ?
Have not Abishai , Abiathar ,
And others gone ?
Well , then , we are not swine ;
And life 's but once .... So we will follow you
No longer hungered and rewarded never ,
But perilously ever .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: It is well .He looses a bracelet from his arm .This was a gift from Saul . In it is ease .Gives it to THIRD FOLLOWER , who goes .This ring was Jonathan 's . The jewel tells Still of the sunny haven of his heart . Upon my hand he pressed it — the day we leapt Deeper than friends into each other 's love .Gives it to FIRST , who goes .This chain ——

lg.l: You have not thought ;
‘ Tis riches — such as Sidon marts and Tyre
Would covet .
There was of Gibeah
A woman — dear to me . Her face at night ...
Weeping among my dreams ....
The prophesy
Is unfulfilled and vain !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: I understand .Motions .So , without any blame , go — to content .The SECOND , faltering , goes .Quietly .A desolation left , of rock and air , Of barren sea and bitterness as vast . Thou hast bereft me , Saul !... and Michal , thou !He moves up cliff , gazes off , then kneels as to pray .My flesh cries for oblivion — to sink Unwaking away into the night ... where is No tears , but only tides of sleep .... No , crieth Not for oblivion and night , but for Rage and revenge ! Saul ! Saul !... My spirit , peace . I must revenge 's call within me quell Though righteously it quivers and aflame . As pants the hart for the water-brook , so I !

div.stage: He bows his head .... MICHAL enters in rags with the lad . She sees DAVID rise and wander into cave , right .

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: This is the place , then , this ?

lg.l: Here
So long in want and sickness he hath hid ?
Under the livid day and lonelier night ?
Little lad !
But he has heard no word from me ?— not how
My father , Saul , frantic of my repentance ,
Had unto Phalti , a new lord , betrothed me ?
How then I fled to win unto these wilds ?
He heard not anything — only the tales
I told of Moab , my own land .... But , oh !
It is his harp .

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: And strains that weep o'er me !... I 'll speak to him ... and yet must be unknown ! A leper ? as a leper could I ...?

lg.l: Why
Must he not know you ?
Ask me not , lad , now ;
But go a little .
Yes .
lg.stage: He sets down the water-skin and goes .
lg.l: Michal
lg.stage: delaying , then in a loud voice
lg.l: Unclean ! Unclean !

div.stage: Conceals her face in her hair .

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: Unclean ! DavidappearingWho cries unclean ? Poor leper in these wilds , who art thou ?

lg.l: One
Outcast and faint , forlorn !
Then you have come
To one more bitter outcast than yourself —
One who has less than this lone void to give ,
This sterile solitude and sun , this scene
Of leaden desolation that makes mad ;
Who has no ease but cave or shading rock ,
Or the still moon , or stars that glide the night .
One over whom ——
The pale hours
Flow dead into eternity .
My cloak , then , for thy tattered limbs . Or , no —
This chain of Ophir for thy every need .
Once it was dear , but should be so no more .
Have it , and with it vanish memory
Out of my breast ——
And from me fall
Link upon link her loveliness that bound .
Nothing . A chain like this
I once beheld wind undulantly bright
O'er Michal the king 's daughter .
A spy ?
A spy of Saul and hypocrite have crept
Hither to learn ...?
How , then
Wandering came you here ?
My brain is overfull of fever , mad .
Almost and I had touched thy peril , held
Thy hideous contagion .
Then who
Art thou to know and speak of her , of Michal ?

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: One who has served the king .

lg.l: And you have seen
Michal , you have beheld her ?
Once , when she
In face was fairer and in heart than now
They say she is .
A night
Under the leaves of Gibeah — when she
Sang with another — David .
And from afar , under the moon , blew faint
The treading of the wine-presses with song .
David she loved , but anger-torn betrayed ,
Unworthy of him .
Speak of her no more ,
Nor of her cruelty , unless to pray
He she has ruined may forget her .
Yet
If deep she should repent ?— if deep she should ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: A jackal ?Listens .No , the signal ! Word at last !To MICHALHe who is near may prove to thee less kind .She goes . He leaps up the cliff .Abishai ? Abiathar ?... It is ! But staggering and wounded ? breathless ? torn ? The priest with bloody ephod , too , and wild ?Watching , then springing to meet them as they reel in .Abishai , what is it that you bring ? Abiathar , up ! answer !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Up !He brings the water-skin . They drain it fiercely .What is it now so fevered from you stares , And breathing , too , abhorrence ? Gasp it out .

lg.l: I stifle — in a universe — he still —
Has breath in .
Ill scathe him ! Scorpions
Of terror and remorse sting in his soul !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: If you have tidings , not in words so wild .

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: Then ask , and hate shall calm me .

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: On , on ! Seek if he lives !

lg.l: Seek if prophecy
Founts yet in Judah !
Is dead !
Dead — and of tidings more calamitous .
David
Tell on . I hear .
Saul gloating to believe
The priests who gathered sacredly at Nob ,
Plotted assisting you , hath had them ——

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: Slain at the hands of Doeg — murdered , all !

lg.l: Was among them ; fell .
David
Abiathar , my friend !... Appeaseless Saul !
Hear all , hear all ! Thy father , too , and mother ,
Even thy kindred , out of Israel
Are driven into Moab ; and this king ,
Delirious still for blood as a desert pard ,
With Merab , whelp of him , and many armed ,
Is near us now — a-quiver at Engeddi
For your destruction :
And yet you will not strike .
David
No , but of Michal , tell me good at once ,
Lest unendurable this lot , I may ——
Mounting o'er every oath into revenge .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Not if you say no more .

lg.l: I know
Nothing of her .
Perhaps :
As did her love .

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: Well , what ? A woman who betrays ?

lg.l: Speak , not evade ;
And judge her when earth has no mystery .
Then from your craving put her — wide ; she is
Unworthy any tremor of your veins .
Dawn-lilies under dew are then unworthy ,
And nesting doves are horrible to heaven .
I will not so believe . Your reason ?
Saul
Has given her — and she will wed him , aye —
To Phalti , a new lord .

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: Cry . Yet you will believe it .

lg.l: Not until
The parable of verdant spring is hushed
Ever of bloom , to prove it . Never till
Hermon is swung into the sea ! until
The last void of the everlasting sky —

div.stage: Looking up , falters , breaks off , and is strangely moved .

lg.l: He 's mad ?
No , no !... an eaglet !...
Falling here ...
And beating against death unbuoyantly .
lg.stage: The bird drops at their feet .
lg.l: A destiny , a fate in this is hidden !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: The arrow !— His !Starts back .His and no other 's ! Quick , no delay . Efface all trace of us .

lg.l: We are discovered — near
On us is death . Open the secret chamber
Within the cave , for from the bow of Saul
Is yonder bleeding — from no other .

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: Saul 's ? But how ; was any here ?

div.stage: ABISHAI hastes to cave , right , DAVID and ABIATHAR listen . Noise of approach is heard .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Almost I am beyond this tolerance .

lg.l: In truth . Therefore it is you rise and shake
Out of his power the sceptre !
Tempt me not !
Mercy and memory almost are dead ,
And craving birth in me is fateful ire .

div.stage: They follow into the cave : but hardly have done so when , at a shout , pour in SAUL and his men , bloodthirstily , from all sides , DOEG and ABNER leading .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: On , to him ! search the caves ! in , in , and bring Him to my sword and Michal with him .Pacing .They Shall couch upon eternity and dust .Weakly .I am the king and Israel is mine .... I 'll sleep upon their grave , I 'll sleep upon it , And hear the worm ...!To a soldier re-entering from one cave .Where is he ? Bring him .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: You 've slain him and you tremble ! Say it .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: A treachery ! You cunningly contrive To aid him , so ....To a soldier from the other cave .Bring me his head . SoldierfearfullyMy lord , He is not there ....

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: I tell you it is lies — Because you deem that he shall be the king , And treasure up reward and amnesty .Rushes wildly to caves in turn , then out among them .From me ill-fruited ineffectual herd ! Away from me , he 's fled and none of you Is servant and will find and for me seize him ! From me — I 'll sleep — I 'll rest — and then —As they cringe , going .I 'll sleep .ABNER and DOEG remain . SAUL enters cave , left .Abnerto DOEG , significantlyThe Evil Spirit .

lg.l: Yes ; upon him swift
It came as never before — as drunkenness .

sp.speaker: Abner
sp.p: And Merab , too , will soon be here .

lg.l: I 'll go and look upon him .
Already he sleeps .
So we may seek us water ;
no , abide !
Woman , who are you , who ?
Michal
Unclean ! away !
Unclean ? a leper ? in this place ? Are there
No stones to stone you ? Hence ! And had I not
A brother such as thou ——

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: Pity ! Unclean !She quickly goes , then they . A space ; then she returns , trembling and fearful .I 'll call him ! I will save him ! David ! David !— I his discomfiture and ruin !— David !Searches .Hear , David ! hear me ! David !Sees SAUL .The king ! My father ! I cannot — am not — whither shall I , whither ...?

div.stage: Flees , as a scuffling is heard and DAVID 'S voice .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Loose me , I say . ‘ Twas Michal , and she called !

div.stage: Breaking free . ) I say that it was she !

lg.l: Foolhardy , no
Return into the cave , and ere too late !
You are duped .
David
The breathing of archangels could not so
Have swung the burden from me as her ... Ha !
Need not lift her veil ,
Or longer stay . The path she came is open .
I 'm here — and here will speak ! I 've hither stolen ,
Yearning — I say it — yearning — and I will .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: These words I do not know .

lg.l: Because you will not .
More all-devouring than a Moloch is
This love within me ——
Love and you are twain ,
As sun and Sheol .
False . I am become
For want of you as famine-wind , a wave
In the mid-tempest , with no rest , no shore .
I do not hear the unashamed words
Of one who has but recently another ,
Adriel , wedded .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: I beg you but to cease .

lg.l: Goaded , chagrined ?
No , but this will I do . The Philistines ,
For long at rioting within their walls ,
Gather again and break toward Gilboa ....
To-morrow must my father
Return from hunting you and arm for battle .
But — many would that you were king .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: I do not understand your eyes .

lg.l: I will
For love of you arouse rebellion up ,
Murmur about the host your heaven-call ,
And lift you to the kingdom .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: To the —— Stay ! Your words again .

sp.speaker: Merab
sp.p: What is your mien ? you will not ?

lg.l: Twice the words —
Full from her lips — and to betray her father .
Odious utterly !
As yonder sea of death and bitter salt !
As foam-girt Joppa of idolatry ,
As Memphian fane of all abhorrencies !
Morning would move with horror of it , noon
A livid sepulchre of shame span o'er ,
And night shrink to remember day had been !
Then Saul shall rend you dead . And Jonathan !...
Perchance you had not heard that Jonathan
Knows to the Philistines you fled — and loathes you !
Nor have not , ah ? how Michal
Is given to the embraces of another ?
You desperately breathe and pale at last ?
To me for aid , to me you yet shall come .

div.stage: She goes . DAVID lifts his hand to his brow in pain . Then ABIATHAR abruptly descends from SAUL 'S cave to him .

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: Not till you know — and strike !

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: I tell you ‘ tis the king .

lg.l: Who lieth yonder .
And sleeping lieth — for a thrust to end .
David
Then shall there be an ending — of these wounds
That wring me — of this wail
Under the deeps of me against his wrongs .
Saul , Saul !... Michal !... Oh , never-ceasing ill !

div.stage: Flings down the sword in anguish .

lg.l: Has Saul
Hunted you to this desert 's verge ?

sp.speaker: Abiathar
sp.p: Has he pursued you , all his hate unleashed ? Are Samuel — the priests , not slain ? my father ? The kingdom is not in decay , and falls ? You are not prophesy 's anointed one ? Seize up the sword and strike — or I myself !

div.stage: Puts them aside , takes sword , and goes to SAUL 'S cave .

lg.l: What will he do ?... listen
MICHAL enters unseen .

sp.speaker: Abishai
sp.p: Be ready . Michalto themWhat is this ?DAVID re-enters — haggard and worn — from the cave , a piece of SAUL 'S cloak and the sword still in his hand .... The pause is tense with emotion .Michalat last , with a cry , as David clenchesAh , you have slain — have slain him ! Wretch ! thou wretch ! And sleeping as he was !

lg.l: And it was you ...?
In lying rags ?

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: Have struck him in his sleep ! And merciless ! And now will kill me , too ?

lg.l: The leper , you ! The faithless leper , you ,
Who drove me a prey upon this wilderness !
Upon the blot of it and death and sear !
The silence and relentless burning swoon !
You are the leper , who have broken troth
And shut the cry of justice from your breast !
Who 've stifled me with desolation 's woe ,
Who 've followed still and still have me betrayed !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Slain thy father ? slain ?Flinging the piece of SAUL 'S cloak at her feet .See how I might — see , see you , yonder he lies , A king who quits the kingdom , though a cloud Of Philistines is foaming toward Gilboa ; Jeoparded leaves it , undefended , for Pursuit of me and pitiless harrying ! A king who murders priests ...

lg.l: Stifles God
With penitence that He has shaped the world !
Have slain ? have slain him ! I have slain him ! Ah !
Ah , that I had thy falseness and could slay him !
Nevermore near me ! never with
That quivering and tenderness of lure .
Those eyes that hold infinity of fate ,
That breathing cassia-sweet , but sorcery !
Never thy presence pouring beauty , swift ,
And seething in the brain as frantic wine !
I 'll be no more enspelled of thee — Never !
I will not hear thee and be wound by words
Into thy wile as wide as Ashtoreth 's ,
Back into hope , eternity of pain !

div.stage: He goes in agony — the priest and ABISHAI after . MICHAL stands gazing tearless before her as SAUL , awakened , comes slowly from the mouth of the cave down toward her .

div.head: ACT IV

stage.stage: SCENE : The house of MIRIAM , the “ Witch of Endor , ” by Mount Gilboa — where SAUL is encamped against the Philistines . It is of one story , built rectangularly about an inner court , which is dimly lighted . Under the gallery which ranges around the court are doors leading to the sleeping and other apartments ; before one of these a lattice . On the left is the gate opening to the street . At the back to one side , the teraphim , or image of divination ; on the other side a stairway mounts to the roof . Above is the night and vague lightning amid a moan of wind . During the act comes dawn . Forward on a divan sits MIRIAM alone , in blind restlessness .

sp.speaker: Miriam
sp.p: Adah !... The child is sunken in a sleep . Yet would I have her near me in this night , And hear again the boding of her tale . Unto the blind the vision and the awe Of the invisible sway ever in , The shadow of nativities that lead Upon fatality . Girl ! Adah ! girl !The wind passes . ADAH enters from a chamber , rubbing her eyes .Thou art awake ?

lg.l: Stand you where
Fathoming I may feel within you . Now ,
Again — you 've hither fled your mistress Merab ,
In fear of her ?
At Engeddi Michal
By Saul was apprehended ? Merab now
Plotteth against her — she and Doeg ?
And ‘ twas in Merab 's tent you heard , the king
Despairing of to-morrow 's battle , comes
Hither to-night to bid me lift the spirit
Of Samuel out of the dead and learn
The issue ?
And — you hear ?——
Many within the army urge for David ,
Would cry him king , if Saul were slain ?

div.stage: A knock at the gate . They start up fearful .

lg.l: Who seeks blind Miriam of Endor 's roof ,
Under the night and unextinguished storm ?
Come you a friend ?
David
A friend .

sp.speaker: Miriam
sp.p: As knows my soul !Throws open the gate . DAVID enters and ABIATHAR cloaked .Thy voice again !— this blindness of my eyes — If it be David , speak .

lg.l: David of Jesse , Israel 's desire !
Let me behold thee
with my fingers ’ sight ,
And gather in them touch of thee again !
Thy voice is as dream-dulcimers that stir
Quivering myrrh of memory and joy .
But , aie ! why are you here ? You have been there ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Yes — in the camp of Saul .

sp.speaker: Miriam
sp.p: In spite of Death ! Do you not know ——

lg.l: I know — that Saul would rather
O'erhYpppHeNtramble me than a multitude of foes .
That it is told him I who shun his ire —
Though death were easier , if dutiful —
Am come up with the Philistines to win
The kingdom . That he would slay me though I fought
For Israel !— But , Michal !—

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: What brews ? She was not in the camp .

sp.speaker: Miriam
sp.p: Men all are mad ! And you who should be never .

lg.l: She is in
Some peril .
You , in more ! And must from here
Swiftly away , for Saul is ——
You are the anointed !
lg.stage: A heavy knock at the gate .
lg.l: Ah , calamity !
You would not heed — ‘ tis Saul !
He is come
That I shall call up Samuel .
You , you —
The awful dead ?
Saul
Woman of Endor !
Woman of Endor ! woman !
lg.stage: DAVID and ABIATHAR withdraw . The knocking hastier .
lg.l: Woman of Endor ! Woman of Endor ! Woman !
To rueing it
You tarry !

div.stage: She lets him in , with ISHUI and ADRIEL .

lg.l: Witch of Endor , you ,
Who of the fate-revealing dead divine .
Out of the Pit you call them !

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: I say that you can raise them !

lg.l: You are come
With snaring ! knowing well that Saul the king
Is woe and bitterness to all who move
With incantation .
I must have up out of the Awfulness
Him I would question .
Prepare
Before thy teraphim . No harm , I swear ,
Shall come of it . Bid Samuel appear .
The battle ! its event !
Miriam
I know thee now !
Saul ! thou art Saul ! the Terror !
Call him up .
Ready is it , the battle — but I am
Forsaken of all prophesy and dream ,
Of voices and of priest and oracle ,
To augur it .
He must
Hold comfort , and the torrent of despair
Within me stay and hush .

sp.speaker: Miriam
sp.p: Then must it be .She turns to the teraphim , amid wind and pallid lightning prostrating herself .Prophet of Israel , who art beyond The troubling and the terrifying grave , Th ’ immeasurable moan and melancholy Of ways that win to Sheol — Rise ! Arise !She waits ... Only the wind gust . Then springing up , with wide arms , and wild blind eyes .Prophet of Israel , arise ! Not in The name of Baal , Amon , Ashtoreth , Dagon or all the deities that dream In trembling temples of Idolatry , But of Jehovah ! of Jehovah ! rise !

div.stage: An elemental cry is heard . Then wavering forms rise , vast , out of the earth , in continuous stream . MIRIAM , with a curdling shriek , sinks moaning to her knees .

sp.speaker: Saul
sp.p: Woman , I cannot — dare not — look upon it . Utter thy sight .

div.stage: The Spirit of SAMUEL begins to take shape through the phantoms .

lg.l: I see ... ascending
Forms as of gods in swaying ghostliness ,
Dim apparitions of a dismal might ,
And now is one within a mantle clad ,
Who looketh ——
Who looketh with
Omniscience in his mien , and there is chill
And cling about him of eternity !
His eyes impale me !
Spirit , give me word !
lg.stage: He falls heavily to the ground .
lg.l: Samuel
O evil king ! and wretched king ! why hast
Thou brought me from the quietness and rest ?
Evil thou art
For underneath this night thou hast conspired
Death to thy daughter Michal — if at dawn
The battle shall be lost — lest she may fall
Into the hands of David ——
David
O !

sp.speaker: Samuel
sp.p: I tell thee , Saul , thy sceptre shrivels fast . The battle shall be lost — it shall be lost .

div.stage: The Spirit of SAMUEL disappears . A wail of wind .

sp.speaker: Adriel
sp.p: Ishui , true ? Is Michal to be slain ?

lg.l: This is no hour for fools and questioning .
Saul
The battle , Ishui , at once command
It shall begin ! To Jonathan and say it .
No prophecy shall sink me and no shade .
I am the king , and Israel , my own .
David
Michal to die and Israel to fall !
Prophet of prophets , Samuel , return !
Out of the Shadow and the Sleep , return ,
Compassionate , and tell me where she is
That I may save . Again appear and say
That Israel to-morrow may not fall —
Not fall on ruin !
And I have heard . Cry then
Out unto Saul ! Betray me , cry you out !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Is the word honey ? Is it balm ?

lg.l: Jealously .
And ask now no forgiveness — not until
Michal is won from peril !
Do you know
More of her ? still ?
Has given Doeg
Power of this .... And to some spot of Endor
Here he has brought her .
And now himself ,
David , himself cannot be far away .
Ahaste , and bring him then by force or guile ,
In any way , that we may from him win
Where she is prisoned .
The quivering
Quicksands of destiny beneath her stir .
Is heaven a mocking shield that ever keeps
God from our prayers ?

div.stage: A faint uproar begins afar ; and dawn .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: The battle ! on the wind . Abiathar , Speed out upon the mountain-side and cull All that befalls .ADAH opens the gate . The priest goes .Adahspringing backOh !

lg.l: I saw her — she —
Is coming hither ! Do not let her — she —
I fear — I fear her !

sp.speaker: Adah
sp.p: She !The gate is thrown open fiercely .MerabenteringWoman and witch , did Adriel , my husband ,Sees DAVID .Come to you with the king ?

lg.l: Unnatural ,
Unkind , most cruel sister !
Merab
You are here ?
Once me you would have poisoned , but the coil
Within your bosom I beheld . And now
Michal your sister is the victim .
Merab . I —
Know not your meaning .
The battle burning yonder ,
If it adversely veers , the king has planned
Michal is not to live lest she may hap
Unto my arms .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Almighty , smite , and save to Thee thy people ! And save Thy altars unto Israel !

div.stage: He bows his head . A stir comes at the gate .
DAVID throws a cloak to his face , as ADAH obeys . ADRIEL enters , and DOEG , who pauses in quick alarm , as DAVID goes between him and the gate .

sp.speaker: Doeg
sp.p: What place is this ? Why do you bar that gate ? Merab , ‘ tis you ? Why do you gaze , rigid ? And this is the blind witch , Miriam ?

sp.speaker: Doeg
sp.p: Lured ? I am snared ? a trap ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Where have you Michal ? DoegdrawingNo closer !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: If she is an atom harmed ——! Where is she ?

lg.l: I was the servant of the king ,
I but obey him .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: And thy horrible heart . Then speak , or unto frenzy I am driven .

lg.l: Unto your
Soft sympathy — and passion ?
She is dead .
David
If it is so , the lightning , that is wrath
Within the veins of God , should sink its fang
Into thy bosom and sear out thy heart .
If it is so , this momentary calm ,
This silence pouring overfull the world ,
Would rush and in thee cry until thy bones
Broken of guilt are crumbled in thy groans .
Dead , she is dead ?
No , David , my lord , he lies !
To wound you , lies !
I see her eyes !
I see her in a vision . She is near ——
Is in a cave — is bound — and is alone .
I will go to her — quickly bring her .
Not
If this shall reach you .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Ah , to pierce a woman !MIRIAM finds her way out .You 've plotted , have been false and bloody , foul , And as a pestilence of midnight marsh Have oozed corruption into all around you . The kingdom thro ’ you is in brokenness , Within its arteries you flow , poison , Incentive of irruption and unrest , Of treachery and disaffection 's sore , Till even the stars that light it seem as tares Sown hostile o'er the nightly vale of heaven .Draws firmly . Coldly , skilfully approaches for attack .DoegretreatingNo farther !

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Unto the end ! unto the end !He rushes in ; they engage ; DOEG is wounded .Your villainy is done .

div.stage: Quickly forces him under . The gate then opens and ABIATHAR hurries in .

lg.l: Only fetter ?
the murderer
Of priestly sanctity and of my father ?

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: Abiathar ! You know obedience ?DOEG is sullenly bound and led aside . Then a panic is heard afar , and dim laments . DAVID , who has sunk to a seat , springs anxiously up .Listen ! that cry !

lg.l: Then
Off with his armour for me , I will go
Forth and may backward , backward bend defeat .
Duty to Saul is over .

sp.speaker: Adriel
sp.p: You must not . A fruitless intrepidity it were .

sp.speaker: Abishai
sp.p: The prophesy ! And Michal !The gate opens .Michal who lives ! who lives ! who lives !DAVID has turned and sees her enter with MIRIAM .Hosanna !...

lg.l: David ——
Michal
It is I .
The cords were cruel , hungrily sank in
Her wrists and ankles .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: My words must be alone with her — alone .

sp.speaker: Adriel
sp.p: Come , all of you — the battle .

lg.l: My lord !... my lord !
I ask not anything but to be heard —
Though once I would not hear . Has all of life
No glow for me ?
I was a woman — the entanglement
Of duty amid love we have no skill
To loosen , but with passion .
You too late
Remember it is so .
Nobility
All unbelievable it seemed that you
Could innocently wait on time to tide
You to the kingdom . Then forgive , I plead .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: But in the wilderness , your perfidy !

lg.l: Doubt of it welleth thro ’ your voice . No , no ,
To save you strove I ——!
Not to betray !
From Saul , my father , penitent I fled ,
Seeking you in Engeddi 's wild .
This knife
Unfailingly into my breast had sunk
And spared me , had not flight .
This — this can be ?
lg.stage: A great joy dawning in him .
lg.l: Beyond all hope it is , even as day 's
Wide empery outspans our littleness .
A tithing of thy loveliness were beauty
Enough for earth . Yet it is mine , is mine ?

sp.speaker: Michal
sp.p: David — for ever !She starts toward his arms . But cries and confusion of cries beat back their joy . Then the gate is flung open and ADRIEL enters , shaken . He looks from one to the other .Davidat lastAdriel ! Adriel ! What have you ?

lg.l: Fell beside him down ...
The fray was fast — Israel fled — the foe
Fierce after Saul , whom Jonathan defended .

sp.speaker: David
sp.p: And my brother Jonathan ! If I believe it will not miracle Alone bring joy again unto my pain ?The wailing again , and deeper groans .O Israel , the Infinite has touched Thy glory and it changes to a shroud ! Thy splendour is as vintage overspilt , For Saul upon the mountains low is lying , And Jonathan beside him , beautiful Beyond the mar of battle and of death . Yea , kingly Jonathan ! And I would give The beating of my life into his veins . Willing for it would I be drouth and die !...As the wails re-arise .Peaks , mountains of Gilboa ! let no more Dew be upon you , and as sackcloth let Clouds cover you , and ashes be your soil , Until I bring upon Philistia And Gath and Askalon extinguishing , And sorrow — and immensity of tears !MICHAL goes to him . He folds her in his arms .But we must calm the flowing of this grief . Though yet we cannot mind us to remember , Love will as sandal-breath and trickling balm O'erheal us in the unbegotten years , Too headlong must not be our agony . Hush now thy woundedness , my Michal , now . See , o'er the East the lifted wings of Dawn .

div.stage: They climb the stair to the house-top . As they look away toward the battle 's rout the clouds part , and over them breaks the full brightness of the sun ....
